evidence.text: The Court orders that the motion for a Preliminary Injunction is GRANTED

extracted.value: June 25, 2025: The Court orders that the motion for a Preliminary Injunction is GRANTED.

evidence.text: Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants are ENJOINED from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the closure of the private Job Corps centers, including the stop work orders and termination and non-renewal notices delivered to Job Corps center operators starting May 29, 2025; from issuing, enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to any shutdown tasks, job terminations, or student removals; and from taking any further action to eliminate the Job Corps program without Congressional authorization

extracted.value: June 25, 2025: The Court orders that Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants are ENJOINED from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the closure of the private Job Corps centers, including the stop work orders and termination and non-renewal notices delivered to Job Corps center operators starting May 29, 2025; from issuing, enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to any shutdown tasks, job terminations, or student removals; and from taking any further action to eliminate the Job Corps program without Congressional authorization.

evidence.text: The Court orders that Plaintiffs post security pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 65(c)

extracted.value: June 25, 2025: The Court orders that Plaintiffs post security pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 65(c).

evidence.text: The Clerk of Court is respectfully directed to terminate the pending motion at Dkt. No. 5

extracted.value: June 25, 2025: The Clerk of Court is respectfully directed to terminate the pending motion at Dkt. No. 5.

evidence.text: the injunction shall be nationwide including having full force in the District of Columbia pending the outcome of Cabrera v. U.S. Department of Labor, No. 25-cv-1909

extracted.value: until the outcome of Cabrera v. U.S. Department of Labor, No. 25-cv-1909: the injunction will be nationwide including full force in the District of Columbia pending the outcome of Cabrera v. U.S. Department of Labor, No. 25-cv-1909

evidence.text: the injunction will not supersede any contrary ruling by that Court or any other federal circuit court or district court outside of this Circuit

extracted.value: indefinite: the injunction will not supersede any contrary ruling by that Court or any other federal circuit court or district court outside of this Circuit
